comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: This is a really good shot of a shop from long ago showing how much has changed and how much has remained the same.  I was scanning the Turkish Delight to see if they were "Hadji Beys" which came from a Cork firm and were our family's favourites and probably most people in the South West! I'm really puzzled trying to figure out what's in the two boxes one lying across the window behind puddings and TD and one upright in the centre at the top of the display?  I have been imagining candy angels with trumpets, candied daffodils and letting my imagination run riot but there is probably a more mundane explanation???

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] If it's where I think you mean (behind the Santa with crackers on his sleigh that says "Crackers from Lapland", then they're boxes of Tom Smith's Crackers... And candied daffodils? That'd be a weird concoction (or confection)!  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: NLI directly above the box with Tom Smiths crackers with five shapes almost primrose like and with shiny bell like endings on each at the edge of the box.  They may also be crackers with a very fancy shaping such as I have never seen before.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Yep, that's them! Very fancy schmancy crackers altogether...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 8214568@N08
comment._content: They say that you learn something new everyday ... today, on Radio Ulster, we were told that Christmas Crackers were invented by Tom Smith in 1847 - Wikipedia concurs! I also found out that the company, Tom Smith Christmas Crackers, is still operating today!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gerryward] That's absolutely amazing, thanks Gerry! Never would have thought they'd still be in business. Obviously too busy pulling crackers to ever examine the logo on the boxes...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
